byline.contributor: Kate Pastor contributed reporting, and Susan C. Beachy contributed research.
byline.original: By WINNIE HU and NOAH REMNICK

abstract: New York City Health Commissioner Dr Mary T Bassett, in response to Legionnaires' disease outbreak that has killed 10 people in city, orders all buildings with water cooling towers to inspect and disinfect units within two weeks; some experts say order is unrealistic in scope; Mayor Bill de Blasio is set to unveil legislative plan to tighten regulation on such towers.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio of New York said building owners had two weeks to test and disinfect the towers, as the death toll from the disease rose to 10.

headline.main: New York Ordering Tests of Water-Cooling Towers Amid Legionnaires’ Outbreak
headline.print_headline: City Requires Tower Checks; Outbreak Toll Climbs to 10
